basics.name: Ankit Gaur
basics.summary: SDET/QA engineer with over 12 years' experience in Networking, Web Security, Network Security and Media Streaming domain. B.E (Hons.) Electronics and Instrumentation, BITS Pilani, 2008. CCNA (2011) Certified. AWS Solution Architect Associate (2019) Certified

highlights: SDET Engineer for Platform Team which takes care of core Networking, Kernel and System Services
Working with Virtualisation solutions on ESXi, KVM and Hyper-V
Automation in Go

work.position: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test
highlights: Component level testing and automation for C++/Linux based servers, which power Akamai Media Services Live and On-Demand streaming products.
Automation using Python unittest based framework. Developed simulators for third party components
Qualified multiple features like SSL support with KDC, WebVTT subtitling support, New Streaming Format support like HDS/CMAF
Continuous Integration setup with Jenkins and Ansible
Implemented enhancements to CI such as Crash Reporting, Pre Commit Checks with Perforce with Python, Jenkins Pipeline and Consul etc.
Maintained local build machines for access to most recent code checkins
Redesigned Performance Testing Framework to do Automated Capacity Determination.
Introduced Vagrant based Virtual Environment setup to team.
Helped scale the team with Interviewing and ramp up of new engineers.

work.position: Software QA Engineer, Adaptive Security Appliance
highlights: Tested core firewall features such as NAT, IPv6, Clustering, ACL's, Etherchannel, VLANS, Inspections, VoIP
Test case automation using TCL. Developed testing utilities/tools using Python
Setup VMWare ESX based virtual lab for testing
Qualified ISA (Integrated Security Appliance) Firewall/NAT/Multicast/VPN features
Certified Security Ninja White-belt. Acted as Security Advocate for the product
Submitted and awarded for multiple entries for TechRadar – Cisco’s internal newsletter for new technologies.

work.position: Software QA Engineer, IronPort Web Security Appliance
work.summary: Functional testing for FreeBSD based web proxy appliance
highlights: Tested core HTTP-HTTPS(SSL)-FTP Proxy, Access Policies, Authentication (NTLM/LDAP), Malware Scanning modules, SaaS support, DLP (on box/off box)
Participated in three major releases and multiple maintenance and hot-patch releases
Automated Build Qualification and upgrade testing using Selenium and Python
Thrice Awarded Cisco Achievement Program (CAP) award for excellent performance
Introduced Protocol Robustness testing using Codenomicon Defensics tool. Setup the Virtual appliances lab for testing.
Debugging and reproducing customer reported issues. Providing documentation for handled features and interacting with Sales, Support Engineers for resolving issues.
Developed MATLAB model for a Digital filter for NTSC Audio and Video

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science
